attributes.action: Form a cross-party commission (national consensus) which negotiates Brexit
attributes.background:
I  think that the issue is too important, so we have to get it right. Such a Independent cross-party, all encapsulating approach will be formidable.
1. It will represent all of us 
2. it will show at the negotiations that; we mean Business! 
3. The whole nation will be behind it
attributes.additional_details:
When we and future generations look back at these historic times we can then at least know for sure that everyone took part and was represented in this monumental decision and effort of exiting the EU. And did it as seamlessly as possible.    

If we do not negotiate with national consensus the chances of us and the future generations resenting the actions that were taken will be inevitable.

eg. the IRAQ WAR and the Chilcott report

attributes.action: Make teaching about tax and local politics compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Many people when they leave secondary school and college are thrown into the deep end of life and know nothing about the world they are entering into causing them to end up in debt or not even know how to pay bills.

attributes.action: Make alcohol activated immobilisers mandatory on all new vehicles
attributes.background:
On average 3,000 people are killed or seriously injured each year in drink drive collisions
One of these was my friend, someone's husband, and about to be a father
If cars, motorbikes and vans were fitted with a breathalyser linked to the immobiliser, not one of these tragedies would have happened
attributes.additional_details:
Just think about what you do when you get in your car - you put your seatbelt on, turn the ignition on and release the handbrake. One small extra step to breathe into a breathalyser before your engine will turn on would be nothing. 
The cost of these units is around £1000, but vehicle (and motorbike) manufacturers could drive that cost right down with bulk orders.
They have been around for years - why are they not an every day part of cars and motorbikes?

attributes.action: Protect more of our countryside and seas by creating more conservation zones.
attributes.background: Disappearing habitat,destructive means of fishing by trawling, aquaculture in estuaries, pesticides in farming all harming our environment.

attributes.action: New Brexit Duty on all imports from Europe to UK to fund Brexit transition costs
attributes.background: The Brexit ‘divorce’ bill is effectively an import duty imposed by Europe on all UK export trades entering Europe.  Since the UK exports are less than UK imports from Europe, the logical measure would be to introduce an import duty on all European imports to offset any costs to the UK taxpayer.

attributes.action: No more speed humps and better sequencing of traffic lights for cleaner air
attributes.background:
Traffic calming measures might be reducing the chance of an accident, but they increase pollution
Cars repeatedly slowing down and speeding up, which almost doubles the amount of harmful gases and particles they emit. Not to mention break dust
Green wave for drivers driving within the speed limit
attributes.additional_details:
It should be a better way to keep the traffic slow and steady.
Cameras could be installed in 20mph zones to keep the cars slow and steady.
It should be speed cameras in front of every school and pedestrian crossing as well.
Traffic lights should be better sequenced as well (green wave) to protect that drivers will keep arriving at green lights rather than red ones if they drive within the speed limit

attributes.action: Government to place a Bill before Parliament to legalise Pre-nuptial agreements
attributes.background: The Government has failed consistently to legislate to legalise Pre-nuptial agreements and to set civil and criminal penalties for commercially and ‘culturally’ forced marriage. These issues need to be addressed urgently to strengthen the rights of all marriage contracts post-2013.
attributes.additional_details:
We call upon the Government to place a forced marriages and marriage contract Bill before Parliament which would repeal the current Forced Marriage (Civil Protection) Act 2007.

The Bill would allow the prevention of the equitable aspects of marriage being used as an instrument of fraud - strengthening the true intentions of the contracting parties. It would also impose set criminal and civil sanctions for the act of ‘forcing’ a marriage contract.

attributes.action: Make Eid a national holiday
attributes.background: Muslims believe that Eid should be a national holiday as it is a religious celebration similar to Christmas. Many people believe this from Muslims to even none Muslims.

attributes.action: Zero Rate all School Uniform for VAT regardless of size.
attributes.background: Children’s clothing is zero rated for VAT depending on size. But, larger school uniform is zero rated for children under 14 if it is unique to a school. No child can leave school before age 16, so this is unfair.  All customized school uniform, should be zero-rated, regardless of age.

attributes.action: Driving licence: Introduce mandatory re-training/re-examination every 5-10y
attributes.background: Driving tech, laws, training & examination changes/improves, as such, we should introduce mandatory re-skilling/examination to ensure all drivers are up to par also allowing removal of drivers from the road whom would not meet modern driving skill/knowlege requirements to make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: We live in an age where someone could have passed their test 50 years ago, and not have any of the modern driving skills or knowledge that is imparted onto modern drivers, all drivers should have to be kept "up to skill" to ensure they are safe road users.

attributes.action: Send a force to free people that are being enslaved in Libya
attributes.background: Are we the generation to be remembered for allowing slavery back? People are being enslaved in Libya in broad daylight and the World knows. It is unacceptable that only lip service has been paid to such a violation of human life. We have been complicit in these evil acts by our failure to act.
attributes.additional_details:
Libya migrant 'slave market' footage sparks outrage - BBC News - http://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-42038451

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://amp.timeinc.net/time/5042560/libya-slave-trade&ved=0ahUKEwi3-Zyv0ZbYAhVQ_KQKHZ7CAIgQFggkMAA&usg=AOvVaw1OKyfqviElPGxqFMjSAiJR&ampcf=1

attributes.action: Include Paediatric First Aid Training in the ante-natal classes for new parents
attributes.background: There have been many situations where trained parents have saved their babies life but there’s also one to many cases where a baby has been lost because parents were lost in despair not knowing to take action. Knowing CPR is critical and all new parents should know how to save the baby if needed be.
attributes.additional_details: Many parents have taken their sad stories to social media to warn other parents of potential risks and advised them to take a CPR course

attributes.action: Highlights of all Test Matches (cricket) involving the Home Nations free to air
attributes.background: Currently only England home test match highlights have to be free to air, which means that the achievements of our cricketers whilst abroad cannot to seen by the majority of fans.
attributes.additional_details:
The actual changed needed it to add all Test Matches (cricket) involving the Home Nations to Category B in the Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events.

Sport England’s latest active people survey shows that over the past decade (since, coincidence or not, cricket was last on free-to-air TV) the number of people aged over 16 who play it at least once a week has dropped from 195,200 to 158,500 and the number who play at least once a month has dropped from 380,300 to 278,600.

attributes.action: Create long-term answer to homelessness. Give rough sleepers services and a say.
attributes.background: There are more than 250,000 homeless people in the UK. We want them to be granted the same rights to health and social care as the rest of us. We want a full inquiry into the roots of homelessness and long-term solutions to it. Homeless people also need to be given a bigger say in decision-making.

attributes.action: Make online markets such as eBay responsible for issuing a full Vat invoice.
attributes.background: Rarely are proper invoices sent out with purchases made on line, it should be the responsibility of the online market to issue a full invoice with sellers details at time of purchase and it should clearly show before final payment if Vat is being charged

attributes.action: Impose checks on companies reporting gender pay gap figures
attributes.background: The Financial Times recently reported that some companies who have submitted data on the gender pay gap within their organisations have produced ‘highly improbable’ figures. The government must set up a task force to investigate them and impose fines on companies who have filed inaccurate data.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.ft.com/content/ad74ba76-d9cb-11e7-a039-c64b1c09b482

15 organisations so far have declared that they have no pay gap. The FT reported that it was 'highly anomalous' for those companies to report no gap. Since the FT scrutinised the figures of Hugo Boss, who initially reported zero pay gap, they have amended their submission to a mean gender pay gap of 32.6%. The law was introduced to prevent organisations from hiding their gender pay gaps. Let’s not allow them to  report false data.

attributes.action: Put additional stamp duty on international buyers
attributes.background: Foreign buyers have driven the demands of our properties. This is making properties prices higher and higher. This needs to be controlled. A lots of properties that foreign buyers own remain empty as well.

attributes.action: To require each energy supplier to set a standard Standing Charge across tariffs
attributes.background: Energy suppliers offer multiple tariffs, which are likely to have different combinations of unit price and daily standing charge. Making an informed decision about WHICH tariff and/or supplier to use is made more complex by having these differences. Unit only variables would simplify that choice.
attributes.additional_details: I've just been through the process again, spent hours doing many calculations and making comparisons between, not only one energy supplier's tariffs, but also between multiple suppliers, it was confusing and impossible to make an informed choice. I consulted acquaintances, friends and family, who all agreed. Having just ONE standard daily standing charge would make such choice simpler by removing one variable. Switching may be ideal in principle, but is often a leap in the dark for many people.

attributes.action: Change the legal driving age to 16
attributes.background: At 16, you can get married and have children, drive a motor bike but you can’t drive a car, this is unfair.

attributes.action: Ban all plastic shopping bags and instead only sell reusable shopping bags.
attributes.background: The impact of plastic bags on the environment is enormous. ... Approximately 100,000 sea turtles and other marine animals die every year because they either mistake the bags for food or get strangled in them, says Natural.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/nov/03/dramatic-rise-in-plastic-seabed-litter-around-uk
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/greenerideal.com/news/environment/0613-how-do-plastic-bags-affect-our-environment/amp/

attributes.action: Withhold all contractual payments to the EU untill a Brexit deal is reached.
attributes.background:
If the UK thrives after Brexit, the EU is doomed.

I believe that's why the EU is making things difficult, but, we too can make things difficult by withholding the huge amounts of money we pay them until a Brexit deal is reached.

EU members are allowed to leave. Thier behaviour is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Change the way fines i.e. Speeding/Drunk and Disorderly are calculated.
attributes.background: Instead of a fixed price fine we should have a proportional fine so it affects each person the same way, it should be 10% of the offending persons average weekly wage (10% of 1/52th, 1 weeks worth, of last year's net pay) or a minimum of £80, whichever is the greater.
attributes.additional_details:
This way it have much more of an equal affect upon the culprit and even out some balance of a unfair prosecution system which effects the poorest more.

For example in October this year (2017) a professional footballer was caught speeding and was fined £440, alot of money for a person on minimum wage but does not have the same impact on someone reportedly earning £37,500 per week. This may be an extreme example however I feel this change allow punishment to be felt equally across the board.

attributes.action: Pass legislation for the use of indelible ink pens mandatory for ALL elections.
attributes.background: In an age where pens are as cost effective as pencils, there is no excuse why the use of indelible ink pens should not be made mandatory. Old arguments on cost and potential for ink to smudge are not relevant today. However, a perception votes cast using a pencil can be manipulated, is a concern.

attributes.action: Spend at least 60 billion pounds every year in Defense by 2020
attributes.background: We, as well as British and US military officials, ask that the UK government increases the armed forces defense budget so we are able to protect our country from states such as Russia and North Korea. We must stop cuts to our armed forces at this critical time, to counter the threats that face today
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-41903960

attributes.action: Increase the funding for additional support for prison officers well-being.
attributes.background:
Prison officers are in a highly demanding and challenging job that requires readily available support systems in terms of both their mental health and well-being. 
We are petitioning for:
More counselling with independent professional counsellors to deal with mental health in the work place.
attributes.additional_details:
7159 assaults on prison officers and serious assaults on prison officers has trebled from previous year (MOJ, 2017); impacting their psychological and physical safety at work, overall effecting the prison system in whole.
We think this intervention would be beneficial for prison officers, prisoners and society as a whole.

attributes.action: Move pedestrian crossing buttons further away from roadside for safety.
attributes.background: I believe that the position of 'Crossing Buttons' is too near the road. Children often run towards the button, wanting to be the one that presses it. A trip or stumble could easily result in them falling into the road or cause a motorist to swerve/brake etc. Bringing risk of accident or fatality.

attributes.action: Post study work visa should be introduced again for tier4 international students
attributes.background: Post study work visa was valid till 2012. Now winning a lottery might be an easy task for an international student  ( that too is not a good example because of no public funds clause) but getting a job with tier 2 specifications is a nightmare for the students who arrive here on loans and much more.

attributes.action: Start teaching a language thoroughly from the school year of reception (age 4/5)
attributes.background: Teaching a language from primary school level is not yet compulsory at key stage 1, which is a major part of a child’s development. If taught thoroughly from a younger age, the more likely a child is to remember the language, which will also help in their working future.
attributes.additional_details: A DfE representative found that there is no requirement to teach languages in all years in KS2, as long as the content of the programme of study has been covered by the end of KS2. The UK needs a multilingual population in order to succeed in a globalised world, for global citizenship, security and to operate efficiently in trade and investment. The research, commissioned by the British Council, also revealed that UK schoolchildren are now less likely to speak a foreign language than those in any other European nation.

attributes.action: Ban nut products by supermarket checkouts promoted for impulsive purchasing.
attributes.background: For those with severe nut allergies such as myself, avoiding the nut aisle in a supermarket is usually easy, however having to dodge them at the checkout where supermarkets promote impulsive buying, makes shopping in general increasingly difficult and potentially dangerous.
attributes.additional_details: I've noticed more and more that supermarkets are stocking shelves at the checkout with nut products to encourage shoppers to purchase them impulsively. Although impulse buying is not something that concerns me, having to weave through the already narrow area to pay for your shopping to avoid having an allergy attack seems totally unnecessary, which is why I think that nut products should only be sold on an aisle in the shop, and not used as a product to promote impulsive buying at the checkout.

attributes.action: Make all nightclubs and pubs charge the same price entry for men and women
attributes.background: With all the recent outrage about gender equality and the unfair treatment of women, I would like to highlight an issue which I feel should have been changed by now considering it is illegal to discriminate against someone because of gender: Nightclubs in the UK charge men more for entry.
attributes.additional_details: This is unfair and there is no logical explanation behind it.

attributes.action: Remove Parental Responsibility if convicted of paedophilia & domestic violence
attributes.background: Apart from financially supporting their children, people convicted of paedophilia or domestic violence should have no further parental responsibility for them. Both domestically violent people and paedophiles should not be able to utilise courts to continue their control.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect the survivor, protect the children.

The HEAL Foundation asks the Government to rescind parental responsibility from both domestically violent people and paedophiles. If someone is convicted for domestic violence, the judge should rescind their Parental Responsibility rights so the abusive party cannot use the courts to continue their control. Judges should end Parental Responsibility permanently for convicted paedophiles.

attributes.action: Make Tv licences free for students studying Media and/or television.
attributes.background: Living in London and being a student is expensive. That, combined with the low maintenance loans, budgeting is a big part of being a student. Paying £147 a year to watch television, that is involved in our study, means a lot of people don't have access to this resource due to their budget.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of media students I have spoken to have also gone without a television licence which has affected their study. However, students are not willing to break the law and pay the £1000 fine, just to help improve their research and their grade.

attributes.action: Create a new public holiday for Indian new year's day
attributes.background: Show the British people that Government policies are truly representative of the the cultural diversity across our society. Diwali and Indian New Year mark an important time of the year for many different groups and we should mark this occasion with a public holiday.

attributes.action: Make spent conviction dismissals a protected right for -2 years in employment
attributes.background: Having recently been dismissed for having a spent conviction despite the protection under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1979. Under employment law this action is unlawful and would lead to an automatic unfair dismissal if an individual has 2 years service. This action is discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Sec 4 of the rehabilitation of offenders act 1979 makes it unlawful to be sacked simply for not disclosing a spent conviction, yet there is no penalty or recourse for the rehabilitated person to take action against this form of discrimination!  
As this is already listed as an automatic unfair dismissal, then it should be looked at to decrease the requirement of 2 years service and treat it the same as the other protected reasons such as whistleblowing, discrimination etc.

attributes.action: The Government should buy Leonardo da Vinci's "Salvatore Mundi" for the nation
attributes.background: Painted by Leonardo at his best, fully authenticated, a snip at £75 million.
attributes.additional_details: If the French have " Mona Lisa", why can't we have "Salvatore Mundi"?

attributes.action: Change Corporation tax so that only UK costs can be used to offset profits.
attributes.background: In the last week it has been reported that Ebay UK and AirBnB have both paid significantly less corporation tax than would seem fair, both have acted within the law that allows costs from abroad to be used against profits achieved in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: By only allowing costs incurred in the UK for UK tax purposes this would level the playing field, deter replacing of UK jobs with jobs in lower cost countries and improve tax revenues. This would also align with PAYE tax rules.

attributes.action: Set a limit on how much homework can be set. (Secondary school and below)
attributes.background:
Mental health problems in younger people is at the most it has ever been, a factor that contributes to this is Homework. Homework if used correctly CAN give benefits but if overused can have negative impacts.

Therefore I suggest a limit on homework to help tackle this issue.
attributes.additional_details:
What I suggest is that the amount of homework aloud to be set is limited per subject.

In a half term I believe per subject (Maths,Science, etc) there should be a limit on how much homework can be set that is mandatory to do. If a teacher wants to set more they can make the homework optional.
The limit I think would work is 5 or less pieces of mandatory homework per half term (Roughly 7 Weeks per half term) in every subject.

In France they have got rid of homework and it has worked well.

attributes.action: Calculate student maintenance loans in a fairer way
attributes.background: Student maintenance loans are calculated on a household income basis. This method is not Fair as parents are expected to make up the rest but can’t with a bigger family. The aim of this is to have the loans be calculated by disposable income per person in the household rather than the overall income
attributes.additional_details: Maintenance loans are currently calculated by household income rather than disposable income per person, meaning that some students may get the same maintenance loan despite their parents being able to assist them more financially, as parents are expected to make up what we don’t get of the loan. This means an only child will have more support than someone with 3 younger siblings because their parents earn the same amount which isn’t fair as one family is more able to provide support

attributes.action: Introduce a cap on the cost of postgraduate degrees
attributes.background: Postgraduate fees are not governed by the same rules that undergraduate fees are. Student are regularly left with a short fall and having to money to help pay for courses or living costs. There is no consistency with postgraduate fees like there is with undergraduate fees.
attributes.additional_details: Postgraduate courses can vary from £6000 up to £25000, meaning that students may have to find and extra £15000 to pay for the course after and if they receive the full £10000 loan from the government, that doesn’t include living costs! This is clearly putting a number of students at a disadvantage and preventing them from studying postgraduate courses as many will not able to find this amount of money. We should be encouraging education, therefore a cap on fees would be the best option.

attributes.action: Put aspects of gardening onto the Primary curriculum, teaching its benefits.
attributes.background: I introduced a motion on a similar topic at a Teachers' Conference last year, which gained much national publicity. Not all schools have a garden but all can do something in aa container or similar. Help can be given by the RHS Campaign for School Gardening and similar campaigns.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence shows that outdoor learning can improve the mental health of particpants, and introducing children to New healthy foods can help to reduce obesity.

attributes.action: Create a ‘Residential Care Voucher’ scheme
attributes.background: As a parent to a young child, I can take advantage of the tax-efficient way to pay towards her childcare. I propose a similar scheme be set up so that people can save towards the often unmanageable costs surrounding residential care for elderly loved ones.
attributes.additional_details:
A scheme should exist where:
Employees can pay into a ‘pot’ that is dedicated to the residential / end-of-life care of loved ones.
Monies saved are protected by a government-backed scheme (similar to savings at the bank)
Savings to the employee are present through salary-sacrifice
Monies deposited  are available should they become not necessary
People can chose to pay into their own account and/or an account for a relative/friend 

The scheme should mirror the current childcare voucher scheme

attributes.action: Request that any Brexit bill be itemised and debated in parliament and public.
attributes.background:
Since the vote to leave the EU there have been multiple figures given in the press over any divorce bill varying between 20 - 100 billion pounds. 
We the undersigned demand that prior to any exit agreement the divorce bill should be itemised and made available for parliamentary and public scrutiny.
attributes.additional_details: Daily updates in the national and world press regarding the so called Brexit " divorce bill".

attributes.action: Campaign for a Festival of Britain 2021 to celebrate 70 years since last one
attributes.background: UK has faced years of austerity - likely to continue up to 2021. This would give the British people a feel-good factor and added  prestige throughout the world, which will promote tourism.  An opportunity for trade and industry visits from other nations to showcase the UK as open for business
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the previous Festival of Britain in 1951 and look at what events occurred from those days and consider an updated version which included London and other provincial cities.   Put into place exhibitions, the provision of a festival ship (which occurred previously to promote British ports and industry).  Ask other major cities to put on events that may be a speciality to that particular region (eg historical interests and future innovations).

attributes.action: Create a January re-sit opportunity for all GCSE English and maths re-sits.
attributes.background: More students than ever in FE colleges are finding themselves back in contexts associated with failure. For many, the November re-sit is too early. January, on the other hand, would allow sufficient time for effective preparation and for teachers to assess who is and isn't ready.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of foie gras throughout the UK when we leave the EU
attributes.background: Foie gras production has been banned in the U.K. so it seems hypocritical to still be able to sell foie gras. Now that we're leaving the EU, we should stop selling it.

attributes.action: Prevent the DVLA from selling personal information to outside companies
attributes.background: It has come to light that the DVLA are selling personal information to parking companies for the purpose of pursuing individuals in respect of alleged parking offences

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to leave dogs chained up outside for hours on end.
attributes.background: Imagine being chained up, especially in extreme weather conditions such as hot sun, rain and freezing temperatures. It's not the way you would treat a human being, so why do people treat dogs like this? They need the basic needs like food, warmth, shelter and love.
attributes.additional_details: I have grown up with dogs all my life, most of them rescued from homes that don't care for them properly or they're surplus to requirement. In Pennsylvania, USA, they have just passed "Libre's Law", which prosecutes owners for leaving their dogs chained outside under certain conditions. For more information: http://www.philly.com/philly/news/animal-cruelty-pennsylvania-libres-law-20170628.html?mobi=true

attributes.action: Make getting a tattoo legal at 16 legal with parental consent.
attributes.background: Waiting to be 18 to get a tattoo can be a long, hard wait but sometimes, not everyone can reach it. It's devastating. If getting a tattoo at 16 becomes legal with the parent's consent then people can get something symbolic before they go. This, I hope is something that many others will agree on.

attributes.action: Eliminate Tax Avoidance - Introduce 2% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: As an example, eBay’s total UK revenue last year was c£1bn and £1.6m in corporation tax was paid. This petition would see eBay pay a minimum £20m (12.5 times more).  All companies regardless of size would be forced to pay their fair share of tax including Apple, Amazon, Google and Starbucks.
attributes.additional_details:
It is reasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated equally and the minimum corporation tax rate on turnover should be the price they pay.

The minimum corporation tax could be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.

Incidentally, FTSE 100 companies, on average, have seen their corporation tax expense to turnover go from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years.

attributes.action: Create NHS teams for the atypical patients & Stop them falling through the gaps!
attributes.background: I have spent my life living with complex illnesses, and this coupled with also having a rare illness, I have found myself falling through the gaps in the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Because my situation and symptoms are ‘atypical’  I have spent the last few years being passed around in the system to different departments and teams, but never being taken on by their services as I do not meet the criteria or “fit in their box”. This has been made worse by the funding crisis, as no one is prepared to take on the atypical cases.

I propose the creation of specialist multi-disciplinary teams to take on the atypical cases, so that no one also falls through the gaps in the system.
